intro: Collomia heterophylla f. daucifolia, commonly known as the Daucifolia collomia, is a flowering plant in the Boraginaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This subspecies is notable for its distinctive leaf morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
